author: Special Correspondent
text:
Workers from the unorganised sector enrolling themselves as members of the Unorganised Sector Workers Welfare Board in Tiruchengode on Friday.

The day-long special camp conducted by the State Labour Department under the Social Security Scheme to enrol construction workers and unorganised sector workers as members of the respective welfare boards here on Friday evoked good response.

More than 1,000 workers, including women, enrolled themselves as the members of the Construction Workers Welfare Board and Unorganised Sector Workers Welfare Board on the occasion.

The officials of the labour department after receiving the applications, scrutinised them and enrolled the applicants as members.

Identity cards were issued immediately.

The newly enrolled members thanked the Labour Department for conducting the camp at Tiruchengode town. Otherwise, they will have to proceed to the district headquarters Namakkal.

The Labour Department officials explained the various benefits such as pension for senior workers, educational scholarship, marriage assistance, provided to the members of both the welfare boards.

They said that so far 52,356 have enrolled themselves as members of the construction workers welfare board in Namakkal district and another 1.96 lakhs as members of the Unorganised Workers Welfare Board.
title: Enrolment camp for unorganised workers
